content: will be glued in place fig 15 push the eyes into the new eye seam and glue in place note if you want to use toy eyes with backings then you ll need to leave the head seam open add the eyes then close the seam fig 17 fig 16 bat page 22 bat page 23 neaten the forelegs and join to the body ref figs 18 19 & 20 1 using a yarn sewing needle weave in the yarn ends on all of the claws at the same time close any holes - you can use the yarn to shape and strengthen them by sewing back and forth through the claws 2 then take a needle and matching sewing thread and do the same as with the yarn sewing back and forth through the claws and around them to build up their shape and strength 3 working on one side at a time place the top of the foreleg against the body near the foreleg placement marker and join the cast-on edge to the body by over-sewing in fig 19 place the foreleg seam remove both foreleg placement markers sits at the back of the foreleg 4 mattress stitch the remainder of the foreleg from where you ve joined to the before after shoulder to where you started the i-cord tube don t worry if you think the forelegs feel a little flimsy they will be strengthened when they are sewn onto the wings fig 18 fig 20 bat page 24 bat page 25 wings template wings ref figs 21 22 24 25 & 26 1 use the template to cut one on the fold from the felt 2 open out the felt and place the bat onto the line that the fold created 3 pinch up each furrow about 2mm as directed by the four diagonal straight lines on the template work four more on the other half 4 pin in place then stitch along each furrow to create ridges 5 lay the bat s body onto the centre fold of the wings and attach the top of the centre fold with a few stitches 6 carefully join the forelegs to the wings - you may wish to pin in place first 7 finally join the inner claw to the wing tips dlof cut one on the fold fig 23 attach the wings to the body back with a few small stitches fig 21 fig 22 bat page 26 `bat page 27 work small discreet stitches to join the forelegs to the wings fig 24 fig 26 work small stitches to join the inner claws to the wing tips fig 25 bat page 28 bat page 29 if you don t want the forelegs then continue with wings as follows ref figs 27 & 28 1 working on one side of the felt wing at a time pinch up a furrow about 2mm in a slightly curved line as directed by the top line on the template below
